meanings.sent1: The cat jerked its head up when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She jerked the door open in excitement.
meanings.sent3: The clown jerked his arms in a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The car suddenly jerked to a stop at the red light.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind jerked the umbrella out of her hand.

meanings.definition: To pull or twist with a quick, sharp motion.
meanings.sent1: He jerked the rope to untangle it from the tree branch.
meanings.sent2: She jerked the curtain aside to let in more light.
meanings.sent3: The chef jerked the pan to flip the food in style.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman jerked the fishing rod to catch the big fish.
meanings.sent5: The magician jerked the tablecloth to reveal a set of dishes underneath.

meanings.definition: A quick, sharp pull or twist.
meanings.sent1: With a sudden jerk, the rope came loose from the hook.
meanings.sent2: She felt a jerk on her arm as he pulled her away from the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The jerk of the roller coaster made her scream with delight.
meanings.sent4: He gave the rope a quick jerk to tighten the knot.
meanings.sent5: The sudden jerk of the train made her spill her drink.
